page.title: 12The media in Abercynon
page.content: Our Domesday Block is covered by a number of local newspapers. The two most popular are THE MOUNTAIN ASH LEADER, which is the one most read in Abercynon the largest town, and the PONTYPRIDD OBSERVER. THE LEADER sells between 3,000 and 4,000 copies a week and has been in print since the late 1960's. Before that date, the ABERDARE LEADER covered the area from 1902. There are four paid reporters and a photographer as well as local correspodents. About 15 to 20 letters are sent to THE LEADER each week,many about local and national POLITICS. Over the last year, the most important story has been the{miners strike.}Even though the strike has been over for some months, letters are still being written about the cost to the country of providing free meals for the children of striking miners.
